pingball.physics

Class OuterWalls

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.physics.Gadget
      • pingball.physics.OuterWalls

  •  class OuterWalls
extends Gadget
    OuterWalls is a special type of Gadget that is used to monitor reflections of balls off of the outer boundaries of the playing field. This class also handles monitoring of other boards connected to the board this gadget is in.
    Author:
    Erik

    • Constructor Detail

      • OuterWalls

        public OuterWalls(Board gameBoard,
          java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new set of outer walls for the specified board. By default, the location of the walls are at (0, 0), and this represents the inner boundary of the walls (as these are the ones that will be bounced off of.
        Parameters:
        gameBoard - the board that this set of walls part of
        name - the name of this gadget

    • Method Detail

      • startAction

        public void startAction()
        Description copied from class: Gadget
        Sets up and begins the action sequence associated with this Gadget - i.e. rotating a flipper. If no action is associated with this, then it has no effect. Gadgets that have an associated action sequence are also added to the board's active list.
        Specified by:
        startAction in class Gadget

      • action

        public void action(double dt)
        Description copied from class: Gadget
        Performs the action associated with this Gadget for the specified amount of time - i.e. rotating a flipper for .02 sec. If no action is associated with this, then it has no effect.
        Specified by:
        action in class Gadget
        Parameters:
        dt - the time to perform this action

        public void putInDisplay(char[][] board,
                int hOffset,
                int vOffset)
        Description copied from class: Gadget
        Puts the gadget into the provided board in text format. The given board may have buffers on the outer edges such that the true origin of the board maybe offset towards the inside
        Specified by:
        putInDisplay in class Gadget
        Parameters:
        board - the board to have text put in
        hOffset - the horizontal offset of the board's origin
        vOffset - the vertical offset of the board's origin

        Stores the name of the connected board with the side it's connected to
        Parameters:

      • disconnectBoard

        public java.lang.String disconnectBoard(java.lang.String boardName)
        Disconnects the board specified by boardName from this board, if the specified board isn't connected to this board, nothing happens
        Parameters:
        boardName - the name of the board to be disconnected
        Returns:
        the name of the disconnected board, or an empty string if no board was disconnected
